message: Just wanted to recommend Murakami's books, I like the bits of surrealism in most of his novels and how when I grab a book, I can't stop reading it.
Can you recommend a specific one? I hear 'Kafka on the shore' is nice.

"Kafka on the shore" was the first I read, it's fun and the most surrealist I read from him.  Then I read "The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle", "South of the Border, West of the Sun", "Norwegian Wood" and some of the short stories in "Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman".  I liked all of them and can't recommend one over another, they are all interesting in a different way.
Now I'm waiting for the spanish translation of "1Q84".
i started with Hardboiled Wonderland and the End of the World, it was pretty great
I've only reaad Kafka (amazing book) - been meaning to check out others... any next recommendations?
@done The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle.  Also an amazing book.
